intro: Pimpinella kilimandscharica, commonly known as the Kilimanjaro cowpea, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of East Africa. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in cool, moist climates and is often found in rocky or mountainous terrain. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
